page.title: 16Parbold's Lost Footpaths
page.content: { }There are about 20 footpaths in Parbold parish. They are not much used and many would have been totally forgotten if it were not for ramblers and walkers. Many of the people who have recently moved in to the area do not know of the existence of many of them, and it is felt that better use would be made of them if there were clear signposts - very few remain. It is regarded as important that footpaths be kept open, and there are recommendations that a map of the footpaths be drawn up, that school children be made aware of them, and that a Footpaths Officer be appointed to provide information and encouragement to the public. Otherwise footpaths and rights-of-way, as in so many other parts of Britain, could be lost for ever.
